title: US Couple Takes Dozens Of Trips After Stealing Rs 4 Crore From Government
content: A couple in the United States defrauded the government of nearly $500,000 (approximately Rs 4.2 Crore) to take dozens of lavish vacations to Walt Disney World while claiming they were travelling for work.
summary: A couple in the United States defrauded the government of nearly $500,000 (approximately Rs 4.2 Crore) to take dozens of lavish vacations to Walt Disney World while claiming they were travelling for work.

title: Pak Capital Locked Down As Imran Khan's Supporters Try To Seize The Streets
content: Pakistan's capital was locked down on Saturday, swarmed by security forces with mobile internet cut as supporters of jailed ex-prime minister Imran Khan attempted to seize the streets in protest.
summary: Pakistan's capital was locked down on Saturday, swarmed by security forces with mobile internet cut as supporters of jailed ex-prime minister Imran Khan attempted to seize the streets in protest.

title: US Officials Struggle To Quash Hurricane Helene Conspiracy Theories
content: In the wake of the devastation of Hurricane Helene in the United States this week, a new storm emerged on social media - false rumours about how disaster funds have been used, and even claims that officials control the weather.
summary: In the wake of the devastation of Hurricane Helene in the United States this week, a new storm emerged on social media - false rumours about how disaster funds have been used, and even claims that officials control the weather.

title: Young Female Soldiers In Israel Raise Alarms About Security Risks On Border
content: Despite the ongoing military campaign against Hezbollah, the observers assert that they continue to be sidelined. Many believe this is partly due to an ingrained culture of misogyny within the IDF.
summary: Despite the ongoing military campaign against Hezbollah, the observers assert that they continue to be sidelined. Many believe this is partly due to an ingrained culture of misogyny within the IDF.

title: Has JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon Endorsed Donald Trump? What He Said
content: Donald Trump on Friday promoted an endorsement from JPMorgan Chief Executive Jamie Dimon.
summary: Donald Trump on Friday promoted an endorsement from JPMorgan Chief Executive Jamie Dimon.

title: 1.3 Lakh Lavender Plants Adorn "Starry Night" Themed Bosnian Park
content: A Vincent Van Gogh aficionado in Bosnia has turned a plot of land into a giant, living reproduction of the painter's masterpiece, "Starry Night", composed of thousands of plants.
summary: A Vincent Van Gogh aficionado in Bosnia has turned a plot of land into a giant, living reproduction of the painter's masterpiece, "Starry Night", composed of thousands of plants.

title: Will Israel Hit Iran's Nuclear Facilities? What Top US Official Said
content: It is "really hard to tell" if Israel will use the anniversary of Hamas' October 7 attacks to retaliate, a top US State Department official told CNN on Friday.
summary: It is "really hard to tell" if Israel will use the anniversary of Hamas' October 7 attacks to retaliate, a top US State Department official told CNN on Friday.

title: This Country Sales Citizenship For Greater Resilience Against Hurricanes
content: The Caribbean nation aims to become the world's most climate-resilient island without accruing massive debt or waiting for promised aid from wealthier nations.
summary: The Caribbean nation aims to become the world's most climate-resilient island without accruing massive debt or waiting for promised aid from wealthier nations.

title: "Heard Screams Of...": Freed Hamas Hostage Recounts Nightmarish Captivity
content: According to reports, while 117 of the 251 hostages held in Gaza have so far been freed, 64 people are still in Hamas' captivity.
summary: According to reports, while 117 of the 251 hostages held in Gaza have so far been freed, 64 people are still in Hamas' captivity.

title: Russian "Spy Whale" Death: New Claim By Cops On How Hvaldimir Died
content: A beluga whale "Hvaldimir", found dead in Norway in August, was not shot to death as claimed by animal rights groups but died of bacterial infection, said Norwegian Police.
summary: A beluga whale "Hvaldimir", found dead in Norway in August, was not shot to death as claimed by animal rights groups but died of bacterial infection, said Norwegian Police.

title: "Collected Bodies For 3 Days": 600 Massacred Within Hours In This Country
content: About 600 people were killed within a few hours by members affiliated with Al-Qaeda in an August attack on the town of Barsalogho in Burkina Faso, reports claimed on Friday.
summary: About 600 people were killed within a few hours by members affiliated with Al-Qaeda in an August attack on the town of Barsalogho in Burkina Faso, reports claimed on Friday.

title: More Israeli Strikes Pound Beirut After Fresh Warning From Iran: 10 Points
content: Israeli airstrikes continued to pound Beirut on Saturday after Iran's supreme leader declared the country's allies won't back down in the war in West Asia that threatens severe global ramifications.
summary: Israeli airstrikes continued to pound Beirut on Saturday after Iran's supreme leader declared the country's allies won't back down in the war in West Asia that threatens severe global ramifications.

title: US Will Not Renew Legal Status For "Hundreds Of Thousands" Of Migrants
content: The Biden administration will not renew a temporary humanitarian entry program for hundreds of thousands of migrants with US sponsors who arrived in recent years, the US Department of Homeland Security said on Friday.
summary: The Biden administration will not renew a temporary humanitarian entry program for hundreds of thousands of migrants with US sponsors who arrived in recent years, the US Department of Homeland Security said on Friday.

title: Mercedes-Benz Fined $7.3 Million For Harassment Of Brazil Workers
content: A Brazilian labour court ordered German automaker Mercedes-Benz to pay the equivalent of $7.3 million in damages for discrimination and harassment suffered by workers at a factory in Sao Paulo state.
summary: A Brazilian labour court ordered German automaker Mercedes-Benz to pay the equivalent of $7.3 million in damages for discrimination and harassment suffered by workers at a factory in Sao Paulo state.

title: Violence In Mexican Cartel Bastion Claims 150 Lives In A Month
content: A turf war broke out on September 9 between two factions of the Sinaloa Cartel, one of Mexico's most violent and powerful drug trafficking organizations.
summary: A turf war broke out on September 9 between two factions of the Sinaloa Cartel, one of Mexico's most violent and powerful drug trafficking organizations.

title: Elon Musk's X Pays $5.2 Million Brazil Fines But To Wrong Account
content: Elon Musk's X has paid millions of dollars in fines in Brazil to settle a row with a judge who banned the platform in its biggest Latin American market over disinformation.
summary: Elon Musk's X has paid millions of dollars in fines in Brazil to settle a row with a judge who banned the platform in its biggest Latin American market over disinformation.

title: "Hit Iran's Nuclear Sites First": Donald Trump's Advice To Israel
content: Republican White House hopeful Donald Trump said Friday he believes Israel should strike Iran's nuclear facilities in response to the Islamic republic's recent missile barrage.
summary: Republican White House hopeful Donald Trump said Friday he believes Israel should strike Iran's nuclear facilities in response to the Islamic republic's recent missile barrage.

title: Trump Promotes Fake Endorsement From JPMorgan CEO
content: Donald Trump on Friday promoted a fake endorsement from JPMorgan Chief Executive Jamie Dimon, who has not taken a side in the US presidential election.
summary: Donald Trump on Friday promoted a fake endorsement from JPMorgan Chief Executive Jamie Dimon, who has not taken a side in the US presidential election.

title: US Says Its Forces Strike 15 Houthi Targets In Yemen
content: US forces on Friday hit 15 targets in Huthi-controlled areas of Yemen, the US military said.
summary: US forces on Friday hit 15 targets in Huthi-controlled areas of Yemen, the US military said.

title: Biden Says "I Don't Know" If Election Will Be Peaceful
content: President Joe Biden said Friday he wasn't confident the US election in November would be peaceful, due to previous comments by Republican contender Donald Trump.
summary: President Joe Biden said Friday he wasn't confident the US election in November would be peaceful, due to previous comments by Republican contender Donald Trump.
